docs.title: Unofficial Daggerheart System for Foundry VTT
docs.text:
This is an Unofficial System for Daggerheart on FoundryVTT.

This is an unofficial, fan-created FoundryVTT system for the Daggerheart TTRPG. The creator is not associated with Darrington Press.

Currently has these features:

  • Beautiful sheets for Characters, Adversaries, Environments, Companions, Cards, Items, Weapons, Armor
  • Modifier System, allows you enable, disable, manage and track all of your modifiers.
  • Automated Fear and Hope gains on action roll
  • UI elements to control your character's stats without having to open the character sheet.
  • Countdown trackers, which can have their values, min, max, color and visibility to players changed.
  • Counters/Trackers on actor sheets to make sure you never lose track of anything.
  • Automated experience system for characters and their rolls
  • Automated calculation of to-hit (roll vs difficulty/evasion).
  • Automated calculation of damage roll vs thresholds.
  • Automated armor slots vs damage taken after threshold calculations usage.
  • Automated Short and Long Rest system.
  • Automated Death Moves.
  • Automated Advantages and Disadvantages, and how they stack and/or cancel each other.
  • Automated proficiency handling for characters, and how it integrates to damage rolls.
  • Inline rolling reference and functions that can be used to create in-depth macros.
  • Ability to send cards to chat in a beautiful and engaging format.
  • Automated Equipment, Weapon and Armor system.
  • and more!

This product includes materials from the Daggerheart System Reference Document 1.0, © Critical Role, LLC. under the terms of the Darrington Press Community Gaming (DPCGL) License. More information can be found at https://www.daggerheart.com/. There are no previous modifications by others.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Actors store gameplay state including resources, thresholds, defenses, and equipped gear. Character-specific fields power automation like threshold-based damage and Hope/Stress.

docs.title: Key Fields
docs.text:
• system.health, system.stress, system.hope
  • system.threshold.major/severe
  • system.defenses.armor and armor-slots
  • system.weapon-main and weapon-off

docs.title: Common accessors
docs.text:
• actor.system.health
  • actor.system.threshold.major
  • actor.system.defenses.armor
  • actor.system[trait].value

docs.title: Typical flows
docs.text:
1. Update traits or defenses on the sheet
  2. Equip items to populate weapon-main or weapon-off
  3. Roll attacks and apply damage with thresholds and armor slots

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Characters track Hope and Stress individually
  • Fear is party/GM level and not stored on individual actors

docs.title: Example updates
docs.text:
await actor.update({ 'system.strength.value': 2 });
await actor.update({ 'system.defenses.armor': 1 });

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Customize how Hope, Fear, Advantage, and Disadvantage dice look during rolls. Settings are client-scoped so each user can pick their own style.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open Game Settings → Configure Settings → Daggerheart → Dice Appearance
  2. Pick a die type tab (Hope, Fear, Advantage, Disadvantage)
  3. Choose a preset or tweak appearance options
  4. Roll to see the changes immediately

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• Per-die type: Hope, Fear, Advantage, Disadvantage
  • Appearance: color, material, pips, outline, glow, edge finish
  • Preset management: save, load, reset per die type

docs.title: Presets
docs.text:

  • Save custom presets and switch quickly before a session
  • Reset to default if needed

docs.title: Per-user behavior
docs.text:

  • Give Advantage/Disadvantage distinct looks to parse chats faster
  • Save a “streaming” preset with bold colors for broadcasts

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Manage equipping and unequipping weapons and armor. Equipped items sync to weapon-main and weapon-off slots on actors and affect rolls and damage.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open an item sheet for a weapon or armor
  2. Toggle Equip to place it on your actor
  3. Confirm it appears in weapon-main or weapon-off on the actor sheet
  4. Roll an attack or damage to apply modifiers

docs.title: API
docs.text:
import { EquipmentHandler } from 'systems/daggerheart/module/helpers/equipmentHandler.js';
await EquipmentHandler.equipPrimary(actor, weaponItem);

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Auto-sync equipped weapons to sheet slots
  • Sends formatted item cards to chat
  • Integrates with damage modifiers when rolling
  • Supports off-hand weapon configuration
  • Honors actor permissions for equip/unequip
  • Updates loadout bars and relevant UI elements

docs.title: Typical flows
docs.text:
1. Equip a weapon on the item sheet
  2. The weapon appears in weapon-main or weapon-off
  3. Attack rolls use the equipped weapon’s modifiers

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use item sheet actions to equip faster
  • Off-hand weapons apply off-hand modifiers where applicable
  • Keep only one primary weapon equipped to avoid confusion
  • Use chat cards to confirm item details with your GM

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• If a weapon bonus is missing, verify the item is equipped
  • Confirm the actor has weapon slots available
  • If nothing changes on roll, ensure modifiers are defined on the item
  • If equip is blocked, check ownership and permissions

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Replace numeric rulers with narrative ranges. Distances display as Melee, Very Close, Close, Far, or Very Far based on configurable thresholds.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open Game Settings → Configure Settings → Daggerheart
  2. Enable Range Measurement
  3. Set distance thresholds for each category
  4. Use the ruler or place templates to see narrative ranges

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
• Enabled toggle
  • Melee/Very Close/Close/Far/Very Far distances

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Works with ruler and templates
  • Scene-appropriate narrative display
  • GM-configurable thresholds per world
  • Grid-agnostic: works with theater-of-the-mind and grid play

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Set Melee very low to reflect adjacent token interactions
  • Tune Close vs Far to match your table’s grid scale
  • Keep ranges broad for faster play; avoid overly granular thresholds

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: Damage and healing apply directly to targeted or selected tokens. Characters use thresholds and armor slots to determine how many Hit Points are marked.

docs.title: Typical flow (players)
docs.text:
1. Make an attack roll
  2. Click the Damage button that appears on the chat message
  3. Select targets on the canvas
  4. Confirm damage application

Armor slots can reduce the HP marked for characters.

docs.title: Selecting targets
docs.text:
• Target tokens (T) to limit who gets affected
  • If no targets, selected tokens are used

Priority:

  1. Targeted tokens
  2. Selected tokens
  3. Error if none are found

docs.title: Undo
docs.text: Made a mistake? Use the Undo button in the damage chat message to revert.

docs.title: Death Moves
docs.text: When a character reaches the dying state, the sheet shows a death overlay you can click to trigger Death Moves. The dialog guides Blaze of Glory, Avoid Death (with roll and scar handling), and Risk it All with automated chat results.

docs.title: For power users
docs.text:
await applyDamage(targets, amount, source, true, armorSlotsUsed);
await applyDirectDamage(targets, hpAmount, source, true);
await applyHealing(targets, healAmount, source, true);
await undoDamageHealing(undoId);

docs.title: Thresholds
docs.text:
• Below Major: 1 HP
  • At/above Major: 2 HP
  • At/above Severe: 3 HP

docs.title: Buttons in chat
docs.text: Damage and Undo controls appear directly on attack and damage messages.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• If nothing happens: check that tokens are targeted/selected and have a health system
  • Armor: increase or decrease armor slots on the character to change reduction

docs.title: Related
docs.text:
• Damage Dialog
  • Actor Model

docs.title: Integration
docs.text:
• Weapon and equipment modifiers contribute to final damage
  • Criticals are supported by the damage dialog and flow through to application

docs.title: Armor integration
docs.text:
• Reduces HP marked by the number of armor slots used
  • Tracks slot consumption alongside health changes

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: An interactive dialog that builds the final damage formula. Choose modifiers, see a live preview, and roll.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Trigger from an attack card’s Damage button, or open a damage action
  2. Review the base formula and edit if needed
  3. Toggle damage modifiers you want to include
  4. Roll to send results to chat

docs.title: How to use
docs.text:
1. Click Damage from the attack message, or open a damage action that shows the dialog
  2. Edit the base formula if needed
  3. Toggle any modifiers you want to include
  4. Roll

docs.title: For power users
docs.text:
const result = await game.daggerheart.damageApplication.rollDamageWithDialog('d12+2', {
  sourceActor: actor,
  isCritical: false,
});

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Formula validation
  • Modifier selection
  • Proficiency handling
  • Critical support
  • Real-time preview of final formula
  • Prevents duplicate modifier application

docs.title: Common uses
docs.text:
• Weapon attacks that include extra damage options
  • Spells with multiple damage components
  • Rolling with proficiency-based dice patterns (e.g., d12 per proficiency)

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use the preview to confirm the final formula before rolling
  • Toggle only the modifiers relevant to this attack to avoid double counting
  • If proficiency is not applied, ensure source actor is a character and formula uses proficiency dice syntax

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: Hope helps players, Fear helps the GM, Stress marks strain. Rolls automatically adjust these values when appropriate.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Roll using Duality; outcomes apply resources automatically
  2. Adjust manually with the Token Counter UI
  3. Use resource buttons in chat or text via Resource Enrichment

docs.title: Automatic from rolls
docs.text:
• Critical: +1 Hope and clear 1 Stress (characters)
  • Hope: +1 Hope (characters)
  • Fear: GM gains 1 Fear

docs.title: Manual controls
docs.text:
• Use the Token Counter UI on the selected token
  • Click resource buttons in chat or item text (see Resource Enrichment)

docs.title: Rest results in chat
docs.text:
Long Rest selections post clear summaries to chat, including healing, stress clearing, armor repair, and preparation results.

Short Rest selections show the chosen options and the applied amounts for healing, stress clearing, and armor repair.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Hope and Stress are per-character; Fear is a GM/party-level resource
  • Some critical outcomes clear Stress automatically
  • Coordinate Fear adjustments with the GM to avoid duplicates

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: Text like "spend 1 hope" becomes a clickable button so you can apply effects without opening sheets.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Write natural phrases in items, journals, or chat
  2. Let the system automatically convert them to buttons
  3. Click buttons to apply effects to the appropriate actor

docs.title: What’s supported
docs.text:
• hope, fear, stress, hit points, armor slots
  • verbs: spend, gain, mark, clear, recover, heal

docs.title: How to use
docs.text: Just write natural phrases in item or journal text; the system turns them into buttons automatically.

docs.title: Detection rules
docs.text:
• Flexible numbers (digits and words)
  • Singular and plural resource names
  • Context awareness to avoid false positives
  • Exclusion patterns to prevent button creation in negated contexts

docs.title: Actor detection
docs.text:
1. Active sheet
  2. Selected token
  3. Owned actors

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• "mark 2 hit points"
  • "spend hope"
  • "clear 1 stress"
  • "gain 3 fear"

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use simple phrases to guarantee button creation
  • Avoid negated phrases if you do not want buttons

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: Advantage and Disadvantage add small dice that lean outcomes in your favor or against you. They cancel each other out before a roll is made.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open a roll dialog when available
  2. Add sizes and quantities for Advantage/Disadvantage dice
  3. Confirm the preview shows net dice after cancellation

docs.title: When to use
docs.text:
• Helpful circumstances, teamwork, great positioning → Advantage
  • Hindrances, darkness, being rushed → Disadvantage

Add these dice via the roll dialog when prompted, or with chat commands.

docs.title: How cancellation works
docs.text:
1. Cancel same-size dice first (1d6 adv cancels 1d6 dis)
  2. Any leftover Disadvantage reduces remaining Advantage from smallest sizes upward

docs.title: Net calculation
docs.text:
• Same sizes cancel pairwise
  • Remaining Disadvantage removes the smallest remaining Advantage sizes first
  • The result is the net Advantage dice pool used in the roll

docs.title: For power users
docs.text:
import { calculateNetResult, generateAdvantageFormula } from 'systems/daggerheart/module/helpers/advantage-manager.js';

const net = calculateNetResult({ d6: 2 }, { d4: 1 });

docs.title: In Duality Rolls
docs.text:
await game.daggerheart.rollHandler.rollDuality({
  advantage: { d6: 2, d8: 1 },
  disadvantage: { d4: 1 },
});

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• Adv: 2d6 + 1d8 vs Dis: 1d4 → Net: 2d6 + 1d8 (no same-size cancellation)
  • Adv: 1d6 vs Dis: 1d6 → Net: none

docs.title: Related
docs.text: • Duality Rolls

docs.title: Tips
docs.text: • Favor adding a few larger dice over many tiny dice for readability

docs.title: Chat commands
docs.text: • See: Duality Roll Command for adding advantage/disadvantage in /dr

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: Duality rolls use a Hope die and a Fear die together. The system labels results (Critical, Hope, Fear) and applies resource changes automatically.

docs.title: Quick start
docs.text:
• From your sheet: click a roll button
  • Use the Duality Roll popup to set options, then Roll

You’ll see both dice in chat with a summary of outcomes and any automatic Hope/Stress changes.

docs.title: When to use
docs.text:
• Action checks, contests, or anytime the rules call for Hope/Fear
  • Reaction rolls by adding reaction=true

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Select or open your character
  2. Click a roll button to open the Duality Roll popup
  3. Configure options like trait, modifier, advantage, or disadvantage
  4. Read the result banner (Critical, Hope, Fear) and apply outcomes

docs.title: Using the roll popup
docs.text:
1. Click a roll button on your sheet
  2. In the popup, set trait/modifier and optional advantage/disadvantage or reaction
  3. Press Roll to send results to chat

docs.title: For power users
docs.text:
await game.daggerheart.rollHandler.rollDuality({
  hopeDieSize: 'd12',
  fearDieSize: 'd12',
  modifier: 0,
  advantage: { d6: 1 },
  disadvantage: { d4: 1 },
  sendToChat: true,
});

docs.title: Rerolling dice
docs.text: Click Hope or Fear dice in the chat card to reroll that die after a roll.

docs.title: Chat messages
docs.text: Rolls post rich chat cards with clickable dice and resource summaries.

docs.title: Chat command help
docs.text: See: Duality Dice Command.

docs.text:

  • To extend results, hook into the chat render phase for post-processing

docs.title: Duality Roll Command Guide
docs.text: The /dr command lets you quickly roll duality dice in chat. You can use it with simple parameters to customize your rolls.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text: Type /dr in chat to make a basic duality roll with default settings.

docs.title: Advanced Usage
docs.text: You can add parameters to customize your roll:

docs.title: Trait Checks
docs.text:
/dr trait=agility
/dr trait=strength
/dr trait=finesse
/dr trait=instinct
/dr trait=presence
/dr trait=knowledge

This adds your selected/active character's trait value as a modifier to the roll.

Trait Description agility Speed and reflexes strength Physical power finesse Precision and control instinct Intuition and awareness presence Charisma and influence knowledge Learning and memory

docs.title: Custom Dice
docs.text:
/dr hope=d8 fear=d10
/dr hope=d6
/dr fear=d20

Change the size of your hope and fear dice. Valid sizes are d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20.

docs.title: Modifiers
docs.text:
/dr modifier=2
/dr modifier=-1

Add or subtract from your roll total.

docs.title: Advantage and Disadvantage
docs.text:
/dr advantage=1d6
/dr disadvantage=2d4

Add extra dice to your roll. You can use numbers or dice formulas like 1d6.

docs.title: Reaction Rolls
docs.text:
/dr reaction=true

Make a reaction roll instead of an action roll.

docs.title: Combining Parameters
docs.text:
You can mix and match parameters:

/dr trait=agility modifier=2 advantage=1
/dr hope=d8 fear=d10 trait=strength
/dr trait=knowledge disadvantage=1d4 reaction=true

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• Basic roll: /dr
  • Agility check: /dr trait=agility
  • Strength check with advantage: /dr trait=strength advantage=1
  • Custom dice with modifier: /dr hope=d8 fear=d10 modifier=3
  • Reaction roll: /dr reaction=true

This feature is inspired by Foundryborne's implementation of the command for their Daggerheart system.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Create and manage progress/countdown trackers with color, min/max, and visibility settings.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open the tracker interface from the UI or relevant sheet section
  2. Create a tracker and set min/max and color
  3. Adjust values during play; changes can surface as notification bubbles

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Adjustable min/max values
  • Color selection for visual clarity
  • Visibility control per tracker
  • Notification bubbles on changes
  • Batch updates via macros for multiple tokens

docs.title: Typical flow
docs.text:
1. Create a tracker
  2. Set min/max and color
  3. Adjust values during play and notify the table

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Compact launcher for character abilities with hover previews, pinning, quick-use counters, drag-and-drop organization, and one-click chat cards.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Post abilities to chat with a click
  • Hover preview with middle-click pin/unpin
  • Quick counters for resource trackers
  • Drag and drop to add or relocate abilities
  • Edit, delete, or move to vault directly from the sidebar

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open a character sheet. The sidebar appears on the left edge of the sheet.
  2. Hover an ability to see a preview after a short delay.
  3. Click an ability to post its card to chat.
  4. Middle-click the ability to pin the preview for scrolling and interaction. Middle-click again to unpin.
  5. Use the small colored bubbles to increment or decrement counters.
  6. Drag items onto empty slots to add them to a section.

docs.title: Interactions and shortcuts
docs.text:
• Click ability: creates a chat card for the item
  • Hover ability: shows a preview after a brief delay
  • Middle-click ability: toggles preview pin/unpin
  • Click counter bubble: +1
  • Right-click counter bubble: −1
  • Overlay controls: edit, delete, and move to vault (domain section)

docs.title: Slots and organization
docs.text:
• Sections: domain, class, subclass, community, ancestry
  • Sorting: abilities are sorted alphabetically by name per section
  • Visibility: items with location vault are hidden from the sidebar
  • Move to vault: use the overlay control on domain abilities

docs.title: Counters (tracker bubbles)
docs.text:
• Show current values for per-ability trackers
  • Click increases, right-click decreases
  • Values never drop below 0 and respect a maximum when defined
  • Changes update instantly on the sidebar

docs.title: Drag and drop
docs.text:
• Drop items onto empty slots in a section to add them
  • Dropping an item already on the actor moves it to that section
  • Supports relocating abilities between sections without opening sheets

docs.title: Posting to chat
docs.text:
• Click an ability to post a formatted card to chat with name, image, and description
  • Uses the actor as chat speaker

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Pin frequently used abilities to read details while managing counters
  • Use counters to track limited-use features during a session
  • Move unused abilities to the vault to declutter the sidebar

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Shows a compact distance label when you hover a token. The label uses the system’s gold-and-dark-blue style and the same narrative range categories as the ruler and templates.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open Game Settings → Configure Settings → Daggerheart
  2. Ensure Range Measurement is enabled
  3. Optionally toggle the scene flag “Disable Narrative Measurement” in the Scene Config grid tab
  4. Select a token and hover another token to see the label

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Uses narrative ranges (Melee, Very Close, Close, Far, Very Far)
  • Renders above the hovered token with readable styling
  • Respects system setting Range Measurement Enabled
  • Respects scene flag Disable Narrative Measurement

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• The first controlled token is the origin
  • Distance is measured center-to-center through the scene grid
  • The text displays the narrative label for the measured distance

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Colors follow --dh-color-gold, --dh-color-dark-blue, and --dh-color-off-white
  • Integrates with the existing range measurement so labels remain consistent

docs.title: Related
docs.text: • Range Measurement: ../../mechanics/range-measurement.md

docs.title: Types
docs.text:
• Item, Inventory, Worn, Domain, Vault, Ancestry, Community, Class, Subclass
  • Weapon, Armor (custom sheets)

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Open an item
  2. Use Send to Chat to share a card
  3. Toggle Equip for weapons/armor to affect the actor
  4. Edit attributes and groups for rules text or automation

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Card-style display
  • Send to Chat
  • Equip from the sheet
  • Track item resource counters (where present)
  • Integration with actor loadout and damage modifiers

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use "To Chat" to share a formatted card
  • Equip weapons/armor to sync with your actor’s loadout
  • Keep domain abilities in non-vault locations to show in sidebars

docs.title: Common actions
docs.text:
• Edit attributes and groups
  • Toggle equip state
  • Post item to chat for quick reference

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Floating UI for HP, Hope, Stress, Armor slots on selected token.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
1. Select a token on the canvas
  2. Open the Token Counter UI if it isn’t already visible
  3. Use +/- controls for HP, Hope/Stress, and Armor slots

docs.title: Controls
docs.text:
• +/- HP
  • +/- Hope or Stress depending on actor type
  • +/- Armor slots (characters)

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Works directly from the canvas
  • Applies permission checks automatically
  • Visual feedback on changes
  • Multi-step changes supported via repeated clicks

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use this for quick adjustments without opening sheets
  • Combine with selection groups to adjust multiple tokens sequentially
  • Keep GM permissions in mind when adjusting non-owned tokens
